title.narrative: EXPAND ALTERNATIVE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIE

description.narrative: MoEVT expands provision of alternative learning opportunities to include less teacher dependent learning modes, focusing on out-of- school children and illiterate adults, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved learning outcomes and equitable and inclusive education

related-activity.ref: 4550/A0/04/105 EQUITY AND QUALITY OF BASIC EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: MoEVT expands provision of alternative learning opportunities to include less teacher dependent learning modes, focusing on out-of-school children and illiterate adults

description.narrative: During this period the Integrated Post Primary Education was further supported with equipment benefiting 2441 learners and a new study on out of school children was completed and the findings have been used to inform the education sector analysis. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/07/2016

title.narrative: % increase in the number of out of school children registered in IPPE
% of learners registered in (IPPE) alternative learning programmes sitting the national examination in UNICEF-supported districts dissggregated by sex

actual.value: 2016:Mainland: 2,441 (M:1,138, F: 1,303) out of school learners registered in IPPE

title.narrative: Availability of innovative approaches at scale to improve access to education for the most disadvantaged / excluded children.

baseline.value: No evidence based Out of School Child (OOSC) in place

actual.value: 2016: OOSC study and IPPE evaluations completed, Taskforce for the development of OOSC programme established with 10 members , TOR and work plan in place, funding from the MOEST received and being processed.
